DOC.brief_summary: This control , randomize , intervention trial ( CRIT ) 20-40 year old overweight individual ( n = 320 ) across Europe order distinguish biologically active component seafood , i.e. , seafood protein n-3 lipid , regard effect risk factor metabolic syndrome , bone health , weight management .
DOC.brief_title: Health Young European Families Fish Consumption
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects recruit advertisement October 2004 April 2005 . Recruitment 320 subject ( 140 Iceland , 120 Spain , 60 Ireland ) . The inclusion criterion body mass index ( BMI ) 27.5 32.5 kg/m2 , age 20-40 year , waist circumference equal 94 cm 80 cm men woman , respectively . Exclusion criterion weight change due weight loss diet within 3 month start study , use supplement give n-3 fatty acid , calcium vitamin-D last three month , drug treatment diabetes mellitus , hypertension hyperlipidemia woman ’ pregnancy lactation . Each subject instruct follow diet , energy-restricted 30 % estimate energy expenditure ( approximately 600 kcal/day ) , 8 consecutive week . The subject randomly assign four diet vary type dietary protein amount n-3 fatty acid ( especially long chain n-3 fatty acid ) : I : seafood ( control , include 6 placebo capsules/day ) II : lean fish ( 150 g cod x 3/week ) III : fatty fish ( 150 g salmon x 3/week ) IV : fish-oil capsule ( 6 capsules/day ) Risk factor metabolic syndrome , bone health weight management analysed baseline endpoint .
DOC.criteria: Body mass index ( BMI ) 27.5 32.5 kg/m2 Ages 2040 year Waist circumference equal 94 cm 80 cm men woman , respectively Weight change due weight loss diet within 3 month start study Use supplement give n3 fatty acid Calcium vitamin D last three month Drug treatment diabetes mellitus Hypertension hyperlipidemia Women ’ pregnancy lactation
